name: Doubles (itch)
description:
Controls

Esc key to exit whether using joypad or keyboard

Joypad controls In menu
  • Navigate
    • Up/down on d-pad
  • Select
    • Any of the right face buttons
In game
  • Move paddle 1 (inner circle)
    • Left analog stick or left/right on d-pad
      • Push left on left analog stick or press left on d-pad for anticlockwise motion
      • Push right on left analog stick or press right on d-pad for clockwise motion
  • Move paddle 2 (outer circle)
    • Right analog stick or square/circle (on PS4 controller)
      • Push left on right analog stick or press square for anticlockwise motion
      • Push right on right analog stick or press circle for clockwise motion
  • Catch (for paddle 1)
    • L1/R1
  • Pause/unpause
    • Options button (on PS4 controller)
Keyboard controls In menu
  • Navigate
    • Up & down arrow keys
  • Select
    • Return
In game
  • Move paddle 1 (inner circle)
    • Z/X key
      • Z for anticlockwise motion
      • X for clockwise motion
  • Move paddle 2 (outer circle)
    • Left & right arrow keys
      • Left arrow key for anticlockwise motion
      • Right arrow key for clockwise motion
  • Catch (for paddle 1)
    • C key
  • Pause/unpause
    • Return
Goal

The first player to score 9 points wins.

Description

Doubles is a 1-to–2 player arcade game in the vein of Pong or Tennis, though aesthetically it bares closer resemblance to Action Button’s Videoball. Credits for music and sound effects go to jaxcheese; colour scheme to a user on COLOURlovers (sorry, I’ve forgotten the exact source!). Thanks to Beyang, Shamil, Kamil, and Ivan for testing/encouragement. Everything else was handled by me.

The game is mostly a prototype. Perhaps I’ll work on an extended version in the future, but for now I’m happy with the barebones result. Feedback is welcome. :-)

If there’s ever a version 1.1, it will include the following—

  • Better AI, including the ability to catch/smash the ball
  • A pause menu, with the option to exit the game
  • Inevitable bug fixes!

And, a version 2.0—

  • Multiple arenas
  • Player stats to be displayed at the end of each game (number of smashes, backhands, etc)

Version 3.0…—

  • Online play
